page.title: 04Oxstalls Farm S.on A.
page.content: Oxstalls Stud is situated between the Warwick Road and the River Avon. Farming here concentrates upon the breeding,rearing,and training of race horses.The Stud was started in 1975 and there are now about 40 acres of pasture.In July 1985 there were about 100 mares,50 foals,and 4 stallions on the farm.The number is constantly changing as mares are brought to the Stud and foals purchased.A foal can cost between Â£500 and Â£10000.Most buyers come from within a 250 mile radius but some come from further afield.A normal day for the owner and his helper would start at 7am and finish at about 7pm.It takes 2 hours just to mix the feeds,then the rest of the day is spent in grooming,mucking out,and schooling.The horses are fed on oats,bran,and chaff.Veterinary fees are one of the major expenses.
